newsitem.title: CHINA: Hainan to declare five state firms bankrupt.
newsitem.headline: Hainan to declare five state firms bankrupt.

text.p: China's southernmost province Hainan will declare five loss-making state enterprises bankrupt this year, the official Hainan Daily said in an edition seen in Beijing on Wednesday.
The ill-fated firms have combined assets of 115 million yuan ($13.8 million) and liabilities of 184 million yuan, the newspaper said.
They include Haikou Number One Rubber Factory and Haiyun Rubber Shoes Plant, it said.
The province plans to merge 17 loss-making state enterprises, the newspaper said. Their assets totalled 966 million yuan and their liabilities were 931 million yuan.
